summary: Hello! I enjoy my work as a harpsichord repairer/technician. I do all sorts of repairs, maintenance, voicing work in Delrin or, preferably, in bird quill, restringing, regulation, do keyboard-workovers when they get noisy and have too much lateral play, and probably all else you could think of. I welcome on-site jobs abroad, too, in case there is no one aroud in your area. I have been trained by Joel Katzman and my own relentless curiousity, and the ongoing contacts with colleagues in the field. I might every now and then try to persuade someone to have real feathers installed, such as crow, seagull, or brown turkey. Or maybe the more historical slant-cut dampers instead of the rather modernist square flag dampers, and so allow the lush resonance of the sympathetic resonance of the undamped choir. A restringing, when it is due, might be contemplated with Nuremberg Iron, or p-wire. which has some outstanding qualities over previously available soft-iron wire. But every instrument will receive quality time and attention, and will be regulated to a crisp and precise toucher that will stimulate eloquent articulation and flowing ornaments. Apart from harpsichords, I have a lot of expertise in repairing and optimizing string instruments from India, I make sarangi bows and rehair them, and am an experienced jivari-maker for tanpuras.

treasury_media.description: Unlimited space to host images, easy to use image uploader, albums, photo hosting, sharing, dynamic image resizing on web and mobile.

treasury_media.title: William Dowd 1975 keyboard repairs
treasury_media.description: A conservatory work-horse, this instrument has seen a lot of use, which reflected in the sad state of the keyboards. After a clean-up and a close shave, new bushings were glued on with all the keys on the frame in aligned position.

treasury_media.title: restringing with Nuremberg Iron / p-wire
treasury_media.description: restringing a Ruckers-type instrument after repairs, and after having plugged the nut. Once the stringing is complete, the nut pins will be drilled and set relative to the registers.  Instrument by Ugo Casiglia, 2 x 8', CC - c ''''

profile_positions.description: In this capacity I would prepare suitable instruments, set them up with proper strings for the pitch desired by the artists, and accompany visiting Hindustani and Carnatic artists for their concert-tours in Holland and Belgium. All artists would gladly let me take care of the tuning of the tanpuras. This may look simple to the uninitiated, but it is a most delicate business, as is the shaping and polishing of the convex bridge, that creates an effect in sound similar as to how a prisma works on light. I have toured with many great and inspiring artists. Nowadays my services seem less in demand as many musicians are content with using electronic tanpura boxes or smart-phones. In 2003 I wrote an extensive article on the defense of the real thing: a properly maintaind real tanpura, which will always out-perform anything artificial, if played and tuned right. In addition, I wrote the wikipedia articles (with input from others) on 'Tanpura' and 'jivari'. what a good tanpura sounds like:   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xk8FYkjIoIM&list=UUn92mhZxs5lknctZc-nzJeQ
profile_positions.title: professional tanpura artist

profile_positions.description: singer of medieval chant repertoir and claissical Indian Music. Here is a link to some recordings of medieval music: Alleluia v. Pascha nostrum, 2-part organa: Troped Kyrie Cunctipotens genitor; Kyrie Fons bonitatis; Benedicamus Domino and 2 two part conductus, one of which was certainly composed by Perotin (Ave Maria). Singing partner is Rollin Rachele.  https://soundcloud.com/user-578221889/tracks
profile_positions.title: singer

skills: Medieval chant, Gregorian from the manuscripts
Indian Classical music: sarangi repair, sarangi bows
Indian Classical Music: tanpura repairs, jivari-work
